content.description: The face looks sheer and vertical, but offers plenty of pockets and crimpers on closer inspection.  Top out and climb through the safety railing to the applause of all the tourists at the top of the overlook.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchors at the top next to the fence.
content.location: The South face of the scenic overlook.  The wall ends at the big offwidth crack on climber's right.

content.description:
To the right of the Big Offwidth/Dihedral. Easy route...few different variations to get up it.

 If you want to use the same bolts as the Big Offwidth, there's an easy climb that is a tad harder than the offwidth to the right, that follows the seam to your right and tops out at the same anchors. Good way to get reuse after warming up on the offwidth
content.location: Labled under Scenic Overlook on Penitentiary Hollow map, but it could be considered the very left most route on the Main Canyon Left Wall.

content.description: This is route that faces West that prows out below the scenic overlook area above. This route is not wort doing, however there are bolts up there. Most boy scouts rap off this station.
content.location: Very end of the Scenic Overlook.

content.description:
Great way to introduce new climbers to the rock. Short with plenty of holds.

 For absolute first time climbers, if you have someone who can lead climb, Easy Nose (78 on park map), is much better, with more variety. However, the Big Offwidth is very easy to setup the top rope for if you can't lead climb Easy Nose.
content.protection: 2 bolt anchors on either side at the top, take your pick.If you choose the anchors on the right side of the dihedral, please note that there is a rock lip that you should extend the anchor point below. The rope will rub pretty hard against the lip, and is totally avoidable if you extend the anchor below it.Â
content.location: The big, obvious crack at the intersection of the Scenic Overlook wall and the Main Canyon Left wall.

content.description: Mostly fun moderate face climbing and a big easy offwidth full of holds.  Plus, you're garaunteed to have plenty of onlookers gawking down from above.  This wall technically ends after the crack - the next wall to climbers right is the Main Canyon Left.
